pullRequest.body:
Define Grothendieck categories in a new separate file. According to our definition, a Grothendieck category w.r.t an universe w is an abelian category that is locally small w.r.t w, has exact filtered colimits of size `w` (AB5) and has a separator.

Some essential theorems are provided:
* The definition is invariant under equivalences of categories, and in particular, under shrinking the hom sets to size `w`.
* Grothendieck categories are have all limits and colimits of size w (completeness and cocompleteness).

In order to facilitate the proofs of the theorems, the new lemma `hasLimits_of_hasColimits_of_hasSeparator` (a variant of `hasLimits_of_hasColimits_of_isSeparating`) and its dual is introduced in `Adjunction.AdjointFunctorTheorems`. The module `Abelian.Transfer` is extended with the induced preadditive and abelian structure of `ShrinkHoms` and existing transfer lemmas are generalized so that the hom sets need not have the same universes. Transfer lemmas for separators and coseparators are added to `Adjunction.Generator`.

Moreover, some notable changes are made in `Abelian.GrothendieckAxioms.Basic`. Besides adding `@[stacks]` attributes, `hasExactColimitsOfShape_of_equiv` is renamed to `HasExactColimitsOfShape.of_domain_equivalence` and is afforded a counterpart `HasExactColimitsOfShape.of_codomain_equivalence` (with similar changes to `HasExactLimitsOfShape`).

---

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

Could you expand a little bit the PR description (your top comment above) in order to relate more completely the content of the PR (which was expanded a little bit in the process)?
Yes, I just went to bed but wasn't done with my adjustments yet and will do some more cleanups today.
Could you add a `stacks` attribute? https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Tactic/StacksAttribute.html

Done -- while I was at it, I also added `stacks` attributes to the AB conditions (`GrothendieckAxioms.lean`). More specifically, I referenced [079B](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/079B), which contains the definitions of the AB axioms as well as Grothendieck categories.

```suggestion
class GrothendieckCategory [Abelian C] where
  hasFilteredColimits : HasFilteredColimits C := by infer_instance
  ab5 : AB5 C := by infer_instance
  hasSeparator : HasSeparator C := by infer_instance
```
Then, these fields have to be declared as instances. Then, when proving results about Grothendieck abelian categories, we can start with `variable (C : Type u) [Category.{v} C] [GrothendieckCategory C]`.

When #19200 is merged, I would suggest you use the following definition:
```lean
-- universe w v u
class IsGrothendieckAbelian : Prop where
  locallySmall : LocallySmall.{w} C := by infer_instance
  hasFilteredColimitsOfSize : HasFilteredColimitsOfSize.{w, w} C := by infer_instance
  ab5OfSize : AB5OfSize.{w, w} C := by infer_instance
  hasSeparator : HasSeparator C := by infer_instance
```
Here, there is an auxiliary universe `w`. The first thing to prove would be that under `IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C`, we can prove ` IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w, w} (ShrinkHoms C) `. The idea is that under certain circumstances (e.g. étale sheaves), the morphisms in `C` (which are in `Type v`) shall we `w`-small (for a small universe), and we would like to get the good properties of Grothendieck abelian categories for such categories. Roughly speaking, a category satisfying `IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w}` is a category that is equivalent to a category (with `Category.{w}`) that is Grothendieck abelian for your definition.
In order to develop the API, it may be convenient to prove first some results under the favourable assumption `w = v`, and then we may transport properties using the equivalence of categories `ShrinkHoms.equivalence.{w} C`.
We already have `compConstIso`.
Oh, I forgot to remove this auxiliary theorem now that I don't need it anymore, thanks.

By transporting the result via `ShrinkHoms.equivalence C`, we may reduce to the `HasColimits/HasLimits` case:
```suggestion
variable [Abelian C] [IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C]

instance IsGrothendieckAbelian.hasColimitsOfSize : HasColimitsOfSize.{w, w} C := sorry
instance IsGrothendieckAbelian.hasLimitsOfSize : HasLimitsOfSize.{w ,w} C := sorry
```
Good point... I'll find out how to get the required `Abelian (ShrinkHoms C)` instance. There is `abelianOfEquivalence` but this requires that `ShrinkHoms C` already is preadditive.
You may have to add the `Preadditive` and `Abelian` instances for `ShrinkHoms` in new files, like `CategoryTheory.Preadditive.ShrinkHoms` and `CategoryTheory.Abelian.ShrinkHoms`.

Before I start -- do you by any chance know a better way than implementing instances for the whole class hierarchy (`Add`, `Neg`, `Sub`, `AddSemigroup`, `AddMonoid`, `AddCommGroup`, ...) required for the hom sets in order that `ShrinkHoms` becomes `Preadditive`?

Update: Oh, I see: I can just implement `Preadditive` and all the relevant fields since `Preadditive` extends all the other classes.

```lean
instance ShrinkHoms.homGroups [Preadditive C] (P Q : ShrinkHoms C) : AddCommGroup (P ⟶ Q) where
  add a b := sorry
  zero := sorry
  nsmul := sorry
  zsmul := sorry
  neg := sorry
 -- ...
```
See `Logic.Equiv.TransferInstance`.

I had forgotten this:
```suggestion
class IsGrothendieckAbelian [Abelian C] : Prop where
```

You could add the `IsSeparating` version above in the file:
```lean
lemma IsSeparating.of_equivalence
    {𝒢 : Set C} (h : IsSeparating 𝒢) {D : Type*} [Category D] (e : C ≌ D) :
    IsSeparating (e.functor.obj '' 𝒢) := fun X Y f g H ↦
  e.inverse.map_injective (h _ _ (fun Z hZ h ↦ by
    obtain ⟨h', rfl⟩ := (e.toAdjunction.homEquiv _ _).surjective h
    simp only [Adjunction.homEquiv_unit, Category.assoc, ← Functor.map_comp,
      H (e.functor.obj Z) (Set.mem_image_of_mem _ hZ) h']))
```
and then this one becomes:
```lean
lemma IsSeparator.of_equivalence
    {G : C} (h : IsSeparator G) {D : Type*} [Category D] (e : C ≌ D) :
    IsSeparator (e.functor.obj G) := by
  simpa using IsSeparating.of_equivalence h e
```
This now follows from `HasExactColimitsOfShape.domain_of_functor J e.functor`
It almost does, but `domain_of_functor` requires that finite limits exist -- so I think this still has a reason to exist.

After adding `Abelian C` as an assumption for `IsGrothendieckAbelian C`, this instance should be moved after `ShrinkHoms.abelian`. 
```suggestion
instance ShrinkHoms.isGrothendieckAbelian [Abelian C] [IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C] :
```

```suggestion
instance IsGrothendieckAbelian.hasLimits : HasLimitsOfSize.{w, w} C :=
```

```suggestion
instance IsGrothendieckAbelian.hasColimits : HasColimitsOfSize.{w, w} C :=
```

As there are no new variables and there is only one declaration, we may remove `section`. Also, by uniformity with `HasSeparator.of_equivalence`, it is probably better to use an equivalence of categories rather than a functor which is an equivalence:
```suggestion
theorem IsSeparator.of_equivalence {G : C} (h : IsSeparator G) (α : C ≌ D) :
    IsSeparator (α.functor.obj G) := by simpa using IsSeparating.of_equivalence h α
```
In the meantime and before reading your suggestion, I added the dualized version `IsCoseparator.of_equivalence`, so now there are two declarations. Is it fine now to keep the section?

```suggestion
theorem HasSeparator.of_equivalence [HasSeparator C] (α : C ≌ D) : HasSeparator D :=
  ⟨α.functor.obj (separator C), isSeparator_separator C |>.of_equivalence α⟩

```

```suggestion
`IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C` is defined such that it holds if and only if `C` is equivalent to a
```

```suggestion
theorem IsGrothendieckAbelian.of_equivalence [Abelian C] [Abelian D]
```

```suggestion
```
These preadditive and abelian instances for `ShrinkHoms` should be moved to the file `CategoryTheory.Abelian.Transfer`.

I would suggest this:
```lean
namespace ShrinkHoms

variable {C} [LocallySmall.{w} C] [Preadditive C]

noncomputable instance homGroup (P Q : ShrinkHoms C) : AddCommGroup (P ⟶ Q : Type w) :=
  Equiv.addCommGroup (equivShrink _).symm

lemma functor_map_add {P Q : C} (f g : P ⟶ Q) :
    (functor C).map (f + g) =
      (functor C).map f + (functor C).map g :=
  map_add (equivShrink.{w} (P ⟶ Q)).symm.addEquiv.symm f g

lemma inverse_map_add {P Q : ShrinkHoms C} (f g : P ⟶ Q) :
    (inverse C).map (f + g) =
      (inverse C).map f + (ShrinkHoms.inverse C).map g :=
  map_add (equivShrink.{w} (P.fromShrinkHoms ⟶ Q.fromShrinkHoms)).symm.addEquiv f g

variable (C)

-- to be moved to EssentiallySmall.lean
instance : (functor C).IsEquivalence := (equivalence C).isEquivalence_functor
instance : (inverse C).IsEquivalence := (equivalence C).isEquivalence_inverse

noncomputable instance preadditive [Preadditive C] :
    Preadditive.{w} (ShrinkHoms C) where
  add_comp _ _ _ _ _ _ := by
    apply (inverse C).map_injective
    simp only [inverse_map_add, Functor.map_comp, Preadditive.add_comp]
  comp_add _ _ _ _ _ _ := by
    apply (inverse C).map_injective
    simp only [inverse_map_add, Functor.map_comp, Preadditive.comp_add]

instance : (inverse C).Additive where
  map_add := by apply inverse_map_add

instance : (functor C).Additive where
  map_add := by apply functor_map_add

end ShrinkHoms
```

```suggestion
variable {C : Type*} [Category C] [LocallySmall.{w} C]

section

variable [Preadditive C]
```

```suggestion
variable (C)

noncomputable instance preadditive :
```

```suggestion
instance hasLimitsOfShape (J : Type*) [Category J]
```

```suggestion
instance hasFiniteLimits [HasFiniteLimits C] :
```

```suggestion
end

variable (C) in
noncomputable instance abelian [Abelian C] :
    Abelian.{w} (ShrinkHoms C) := abelianOfEquivalence (inverse C)
```

```suggestion
If `C` is an abelian category, we shall say that it satisfies `IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C`
if it is locally small (relative to `w`), has exact filtered colimits of size `w` (AB5) and has a separator.
If `[Category.{v} C]` and `w = v`, this means that `C` satisfies AB5 and has a separator;
general results about Grothendieck abelian categories can be
reduced to this case using the instance `ShrinkHoms.isGrothendieckAbelian` below.
The introduction of the auxiliary universe `w` shall be needed for certain
applications to categories of sheaves.
```

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Abelian/GrothendieckAxioms): introduce Grothendieck categories
